definition: to feel relieved/to feel reassured/to be at ease
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: There ◎ over-temperature protection device, safer and more at ease.
sentences.chinese: 内设过温保护装置，更安全，更放心。

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law hasten sons-in-law to buy houses, thus they may assure before their daughters getting married.
sentences.chinese: 丈母娘督促小女婿快点买房，这样才放心嫁女儿。

sentences.english: Let me reassure you that it's standard practice.
sentences.chinese: 有关那一点，请您尽管放心好了。

sentences.english: And the much-awaited announcement of the bank rescue plan left everyone confused rather than reassured.
sentences.chinese: 而期待已久的银行救援计划让众人疑惑而非放心。

sentences.english: He assures Andre that he will soon get to Teri and Kim.
sentences.chinese: 他叫安德烈放心，他马上会着手“解决”泰瑞和金姆。

sentences.english: The military situation was clearly not disturbing him, and Bismarck was enormously reassured.
sentences.chinese: 战情显然没有令他不安，俾斯麦大感放心了。

sentences.english: Players can be at ease use will not be found.
sentences.chinese: 玩家可以放心使用不会被发现。

sentences.english: “All right,” Hu says equably, “then that's good enough for me.
sentences.chinese: “好吧”，胡主席平静地说，“这我就放心了。

sentences.english: To let us worry, Yellow in the final contract plus a supplementary.
sentences.chinese: 为了让我们放心，郭晓勇在合同的最后加了一个附则。

sentences.english: You let me go, felt relieved, the daddy can support.
sentences.chinese: 你就让我去吧，放心，爸爸撑得住。

sentences.english: Gaines assures him that the job will be accomplished by the end of the day.
sentences.chinese: 盖恩斯要他放心，在今天结束前任务会被完成的。

sentences.english: "We operate under great competitive worry, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我们在对激烈竞争放心不下的情况下经营，”他说。

sentences.english: Maintenance depots across the country, giving you more at ease use.
sentences.chinese: 遍布全国的维修站，让您更放心的使用。

sentences.english: You trust, the not dares to chew a tongue.
Navy blue is a trusted colour and gives us confidence, " Lindsay said."
sentences.chinese: 藏青色可以放心使用，它能给人自信。

sentences.english: Becky sent out the invitations and started preparations confidently.
sentences.chinese: 蓓基寄出请柬之后开始放心大胆地着于做准备了。

definition: at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
to cause no trouble/to be spared worry/worry-free

pinyin: ba3 xin1 fang4 zai4 du4 zi5 li3

definition: fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
guarantee/to guarantee/to ensure/to safeguard/to pledge/CL:個|个[ge4]
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
